The coffee shop manages to serve some very tender croissants, and they’re serious about the coffee too, roasting their own beans.THE VIBE IS: well, democratic! Library folks (read students of all ages), trendy boutique workers, and pastry fiends flock here.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day Monday through Friday from 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m., and Saturday and Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.—Christine MuhlkePhoto by Ditte IsagerWE ALSO LOVEThe Coffee CollectiveA pour-over (and upcycled coffee kombucha) is always in reach, thanks to this mini chainLa BanchinaGet real R&R in at this Amager Harbor vegetable-focused restaurant with a few surprisesMirabellePlan a mini croissant- and yogurt-filled vacation at this café-like spot in NørreboroExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
